entries.meaning: A pan used for baking patties. [from 17th c.]
examples: I heard the most uncommon and unaccountable noise that can be imagined. It was, in fact, occasioned by the clattering of tin pattypans and a Dutch oven against the sides of the panniers.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Canada, US) A small variety of squash with a scalloped rim and creamy white flesh; a pattypan squash. [from 19th c.]
